tag_line: Was criticised for taking money from Saudi Arabia
2_sentence_summary: Uber was criticised for accepting a massive investment from a Saudi Arabia -controlled fund, over the Gulf monarchy's severe restriction of women's rights

tag_line: Didn't want to be seen as critical of Donald Trump
2_sentence_summary: Uber pulled out of a deal to distribute a local magazine in Cleveland, Ohio during the Republican National Convention, after the magazine's issue prominently criticised Donald Trump

tag_line: Talked about opposition research on critics
2_sentence_summary: A senior Uber executive suggested that the company could hire opposition researchers to dig into the personal lives of critical journalists, and use the information to discredit them. The executive subsequently said he regretted the remarks, but subsequent reporting shown that Uber did hire a team of researchers at the firm Ergo to conduct opposition research.

tag_line: Sabotaged competitors
2_sentence_summary: Uber hired contractors to request rides from Lyft and recruit drivers, often leading to cancelled rides– in order to avoid detection – and low ratings. It called the program operation SLOG.

tag_line: Denied it used Twitter bots to campaign
2_sentence_summary: Uber has denied a report that Twitter bots were lobbying for it over a New Jersey bill

tag_line: Did opposition research on critics
2_sentence_summary: In the course of an anti-trust lawsuit, mentioned separately, it was alleged that an investigator working for Uber fraudulently misrepresented himself as a journalist in order to dig up information on both the plaintiff and his lawyer

tag_line: Agreed to a non-union form of driver representation
2_sentence_summary: In May 2016 Uber announced that it would recognise a drivers' group associated with the International Association of Machinists union. The five-year deal provided for monthly meetings, an appeals process, but attracted criticism because members would not be able to bargain formally with the company over fares, benefits and protections. The company also announced a separate series of talks over portable benefits for its drivers. A separate organisation, the Uber Drivers Network, said the new organisation sounded "bogus".

tag_line: Did opposition research on critics
2_sentence_summary: Uber commissioned a CIA linked research firm to investigate union politics in Seattle, in the wake of legislation that allowed ride hailing drivers to unionise

tag_line: Didn't want to share data
2_sentence_summary: One of the issues over which Uber pulled out of Austin, Texas, was a data reporting requirement endorsed by municipal referendum

tag_line: Didn't share useful data
2_sentence_summary: An information sharing agreement between Uber and Boston has so far been a disappointment to the city, which has been unable to extract usable conclusions to inform city planning from the data.

tag_line: Got hacked
2_sentence_summary: Uber alleged that Lyft hacked it and stole data, while Lyft alleged that a former senior employee had broken a nondisclosure agreement after moving to Uber

tag_line: Didn't respect data privacy
2_sentence_summary: Uber agreed to pay $7.5 million to settle a lawsuit by drivers who claimed that the company terminated drivers based on consumer background reports on drivers without permission. The settlement was to require a judge's permission.

tag_line: Taxi drivers protested Uber's impact on their livelihoods
2_sentence_summary: Taxi drivers angry at proposals to legalise Uber shouted down a city council meeting, which was then held behind closed doors

tag_line: Taxi drivers protested Uber's impact on their livelihoods
2_sentence_summary: A former vice president's daughter was one passenger caught up in one of several "raids" on unlicensed Uber drivers by taxi drivers who say their livelihood is threatened by the service

tag_line: Taxi drivers protested Uber's impact on their livelihoods
2_sentence_summary: Taxi drivers protested against light-touch regulation for Uber drivers, who did not require a licence, insurance, or to pay mandatory union fees

tag_line: Taxi drivers protested Uber's impact on their livelihoods
2_sentence_summary: The federation representing Japanese taxi drivers criticised Toyota, a national institution, for its collaboration with Uber. "Toyota is sending supplies to our enemy," said the federation's chairman.

tag_line: Taxi drivers protested Uber's impact on their livelihoods
2_sentence_summary: An umbrella organisation for taxi drivers promised to bring the city to a halt unless the government shuts down Uber. The organisation has denied that its members are behind an attack on an Uber driver.

tag_line: Taxi drivers protested Uber's impact on their livelihoods
2_sentence_summary: "A protest against Uber in Guadalajara, Mexico, turned violent [...], as taxi drivers demonstrating against Uber and other ride-hailing services clashed with supporters of the companies and with police."

tag_line: Taxi drivers protested Uber's impact on their livelihoods
2_sentence_summary: 20 meter taxi drivers who blocked a street in protest against Uber were dispersed by police deploying stun grenades. 15 were arrested and charged with public disorder.

tag_line: Taxi drivers protested Uber's impact on their livelihoods
2_sentence_summary: "The South African National Taxi Council (Santaco) has described the alleged special treatment government is giving Uber drivers as a recipe for violence"

tag_line: Taxi drivers have suffered from the arrival of Uber
2_sentence_summary: Since Uber arrived in Taiwan in 2013, the country's taxi business has fallen by between 30 and 50%, an industry representative claimed.
actors: Taxicab and Intercity Bus Business Association

tag_line: Taxi drivers argued Uber should be subject to the same regulations
2_sentence_summary: A federal judge ordered Boston to set out plans to regulate ride hailing companies, and to treat them like legacy cabs in the meantime. The judge rejected representations from the city and state of Massachusetts that ride hailing apps were qualitatively different. The judgement may have prompted regulatory legislation passed in August 2016.

tag_line: Taxi drivers argued Uber should be subject to the same regulations
2_sentence_summary: Legacy industry drivers have launched a lawsuit, complaining that they are subject to onerous regulations and costs not applied to Uber

tag_line: Taxi drivers protested Uber's impact on their livelihoods
2_sentence_summary: Uber drivers and cabbies picketed an Uber event at the Democratic National Convention, protesting pay, poor service for disabled riders, and poor driver treatment
actors: Fair Ride Philly, Philadelphia Limousine Drivers Association

tag_line: A tax on Uber helped traditional taxi drivers
2_sentence_summary: Ridesharing services were legalised as part of a package that levied a one dollar per trip fee to help fund an adjustment package for taxi drivers. But a proposal for minimum standards of pay for rideshare drivers was knocked back.

tag_line: Taxi drivers protested Uber's impact on their livelihoods
2_sentence_summary: Taxi drivers protested over plummeting incomes, while regulators said that Uber was breaking the law by failing to carry out proper driver checks
outcome: Official would not comment on whether any action was planned

tag_line: Hired expensive lobbyists to influence politicians
2_sentence_summary: Uber hired Princess Beatrice's boyfriend, amongst other well-connected, highly paid lobbyists to influence public policy around the world. "There is, he says, a certain Uber 'type' emerging and ruffling feathers on the London tech scene, which still likes to promote a craft-beer-and-ping-pong sort of image. 'They're all extroverts, they're all super- connected, they all went to a great university. They're probably all members of Annabel's and Loulou's. If you follow Uber employees on Instagram, you'll see they've flown to Val d'Isère or Whistler for the weekend,' says Pleeth."

tag_line: Hired expensive lobbyists to influence politicians
2_sentence_summary: Uber and Lyft, which have been trying to influence the Legislature as it molds regulations for the ride-sharing industry, spent more than $317,000 combined in the first six months of this year on lobbyists. That included $93,000 in fees paid by Lyft for what records described as “public relations ex-penses.”"

tag_line: Hired expensive lobbyists to influence politicians
2_sentence_summary: Uber spent more than $750,000 in the first half of 2016 on lobbying and campaigning – unsuccessfully, by the end of that time –in New York state. Their opponents spent less than half that amount.

tag_line: Hired expensive lobbyists to influence politicians
2_sentence_summary: An intense lobbying drive, including former Obama aide David proof and 10 full-time local lobbyists, was part of a campaign which successfully turned both riders and drivers into advocates for the company. The campaign, which ultimately steamrollered City Hall opposition, was emblematic of Uber's playbook.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: Uber slashed fares by up to 22% in 10 of the 26 Indian cities in which it operated in April 2016, compounding a 40% cut in February the previous year in all cities except Calcutta. The company claimed, as it had in other locations, that due to increased ride frequency, drivers as well as riders would ultimately benefit.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: Hundreds of Uber drivers went on strike in Kenya for a day to protest against cuts to fares by up to 35%. The drivers, organised in the Kenya taxi Digital Association also demanded that Uber reduce its commission from 25% to 15% and commission threatened to leave to another service.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: Mexican Uber drivers went on strike for a day in July 2016, against Uber Pool, "a system that pays very little" and demanding that Uber reduce its commission and stop new drivers registering with the service.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: After an April 2016 fair cut and a move to allow unlicensed operators to drive for Uber, several drivers said that working for the company had become unsustainable.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: About 500 Uber drivers have joined a local union in a bid to institute legal action against the company over pay and working conditions
actors: South Africa Transport and Allied Workers Union

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: A unilateral 15% fare reduction and commission hike in three cities in May 2016 led some drivers to talk about a strike. But because the service is illegal in the country, there was no prospect of legal recourse.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: Uber drivers announced that they planned to stage a 24-hour strike in protest against falling earnings. The announcement was made by the Midland Uber Driver Forum.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: Up to 300 people, including Uber drivers, protested against low pay outside the company's London office

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: Chicago Uber drivers begun to band together after finding adding some weeks they earned just nine dollars an hour, after expenses and before tax

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: Uber invited drivers from outside Cleveland to work in the city during the Republican National Convention, but a flood of new entrants lowered earnings to below minimum wage in some cases. Drivers also spoke about previous fare cuts.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: Internal Uber data covering more than 1 million rides in three cities – Denver, Detroit, and Huston – suggested that drivers earned an average of between $13.17 and $8.77 per hour, depending on the market, after commission and expenses.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: A Las Vegas Uber driver described how his earnings were cut nearly in half after a rate cut in early 2016

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: More than 50 Uber drivers protested in North Hollywood against a September 2014 fare cut, which one described as the fourth in 18 months. Drivers complained that so-called "Uber math", which implies that lower fares can lead to equivalent or improved income through lower downtime, doesn't work.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: Fare cuts of up to 45% in more than 100 US cities in January 2016 left many Uber drivers saying that they were having trouble making ends meet.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: A sample of payslips from eight New York City taxi drivers examined in November 2014 showed that "the average net income per hour for the eight drivers was $21.90, roughly 10 dollars per hour less than the combined hourly wage from the raw Uber data."

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: A local journalist who worked as an Uber driver in Philadelphia during summer 2015 found that she made just $9.34 an hour, after commission and expenses. To take home $90,000 a year, a figure used by the company, she would have needed to work 27 hours a day, 365 days a year.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: After a US-wide price cut in January 2016, Portland drivers say they are taking home around seven dollars power, down from nine dollars.

tag_line: Left drivers struggling after fare cuts
2_sentence_summary: Following a January 2015 fare cut, Uber drivers in Washington DC described trouble making ends meet. Despite limited evidence from Uber that fare cuts can in some circumstances lead to increased driver revenue – at least pre-costs – drivers said that that was not their experience.

tag_line: Offered sub-prime auto loans to recruit drivers
2_sentence_summary: Uber partnered with and promoted sub-prime auto-finance lenders to prospective drivers without vehicles. Those who took up the offer were faced with exorbitant repayments.

tag_line: Offered sub-prime auto loans to recruit drivers
2_sentence_summary: Regulators initiated investigations of Uber's financing deals to allow drivers to acquire cars at what a commentator said were "awful" terms

tag_line: Offered sub-prime auto loans to recruit drivers
2_sentence_summary: Uber has been offering incentives, including minimum fares, cash payments and lease schemes – of the sort that have been elsewhere criticised as predatory finance – to drivers in central Illinois

tag_line: Offered sub-prime auto loans to recruit drivers
2_sentence_summary: In order to get new Uber drivers onto the road, the company has begun to target those who don't have cars, and who wouldn't ordinarily be able to afford them, through a car lease scheme. Auto-finance experts said the leases are "expensive, even predatory," Bloomberg summarised.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Uber resorted to using bitcoin in attempts to bypass a government crackdown, which followed the company's refusal to cease operations despite being ruled illegal. The authorities responded with a ban on payments to the company, as well as arrests.

tag_line: Withdrew, was banned, or not permitted
2_sentence_summary: A Northern Territory Cabinet meeting banned Uber from operating. The Labour Party said in June 2016 that it would allow the company to operate if it won the August election. It failed to do so.

tag_line: Withdrew, was banned, or not permitted
2_sentence_summary: The NT government blocked changes to legalise ridesharing apps in February 2016. The Labor Party promised that if it won elections slated for August 2016, it would legalise Uber.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Uber drivers were fined more than AU$1.7 million in three months from late April 2016 as a result of the law enforcement campaign to catch drivers. Uber has continued to operate illegally in Queensland and has sought to thwart known officials by blocking their access to the app.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: After operating in a legal grey area for some time, driving for Uber was found to be illegal in a prosecution concluded in December 2015. In May 2016, that finding was overruled by a higher court. In June 2016, legislators brought forward proposals to formally regulate Uber.

tag_line: Drivers narrowly escaped prosecution
2_sentence_summary: 12 Uber drivers were let off the hook as the state taxi regulator decided not to pursue charges in the light of legislation set to legally regulate the service

tag_line: Made concessions to enter into a regulatory deal
2_sentence_summary: The Mayor of South America's largest city acted to regulate right hailing apps in exchange for a mileage fee, overriding attempts by city legislators to ban the apps. Taxi drivers had held protests, blocking roads.

tag_line: Withdrew, was banned, or not permitted
2_sentence_summary: Uber had withdrawn from Alberta in February 2016, but returned after the province approved a new sort of insurance policy affordable for right hailing company drivers

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Proposals to regulate ride hailing apps and drivers caused controversy as they progressed through through the London city council, while Uber continued to operate illegally. Legislators were set to make a decision in autumn 2016.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Ontario's insurance regulator approved an insurance plan to cover Uber's drivers and passengers. The plan, which will be paid for by the company, ends drivers' legal limbo.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: A provincial taxi bill was voted into law, requiring ride hailing drivers to hold taxi permits. But an opposition party and taxi drivers said that the proposals were still unfair.
outcome: Bill passed – may have compromised on single fare structure initially in the bill?

tag_line: Withdrew, was banned, or not permitted
2_sentence_summary: Uber is effectively prohibited in Vancouver, with reports disagreeing on the prospects for legalisation in 2017

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: China instituted ride hailing regulations, set to take effect in November 2016, in July 2016. Days later, Uber's Chinese operation was bought out by its principal Chinese competitor in exchange for a minority stake – a move that may have been prompted by the proscription on charging below cost price.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Authorities seized more than 1200 vehicles in a crackdown on Uber drivers in June 2016, saying that the service was illegal. An Uber spokesperson said that no administrative or legal act had declared their service outside the law, and has refused to register as a taxi service. Uber was fined by a court in March 2016.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: More than 40 Uber drivers have been convicted in Denmark since the service started operating in 2014

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: A court fined Uber €800,000 and found two of its executives guilty on criminal charges for running an illegal transport service using nonprofessional drivers – UberPop. The service was suspended in 2015.
actors: Public prosecutor, National Union of Taxis
notes: "UberPop has been declared illegal by courts in Italy, Spain and Germany, and appeals are pending in Belgium and the Netherlands. . . The company’s problems in Europe have led it to shift its focus to its service staffed by professional drivers, which has grown rapidly in France and now employs about 10,000 drivers."
column28: "France is Uber’s second-largest market in the world, by revenues, and its licensed driver car service has grown quickly.. . . The official body that collects social security contributions recently moved to force the company to reclassify its drivers as employees."

tag_line: The authorities explored a regulatory proposal
2_sentence_summary: Legislators have proposed that ride hailing service drivers will require a chauffeur license, which can be expensive and hard to obtain. Currently one third of Uber drivers use a "collective transport" permit.

tag_line: Obtained light-touch regulation
2_sentence_summary: A "statement of understanding" between Uber and the Ghanaian Ministry of transport promises "a new, forward-looking regulatory framework that allows for ridesharing technology".

tag_line: Withdrew, was banned, or not permitted
2_sentence_summary: After operating outside the law for some time, Uber withdrew from Hungary after legislation was introduced to allow the government to block Internet access to ridesharing apps whereof drivers did not comply with taxi regulations

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: In a May 2016 letter, the local radio taxi association wrote to several government ministries, claiming that Uber and Ola – it's Indian rival – were violating guidelines issued by the government earlier in the year by deploying "cash discounts, financial inducements and disproportionate incentives".

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: The Delhi High Court banned ride hailing apps from charging above government-prescribed rates, even during surge pricing. Uber's lawyers said they would take instruction from their clients before appearing again before the court.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Indian Internet service providers have said that they are unable to block access to ride hailing apps, including that of Uber, because the encryption they use is too sophisticated. The Delhi government had tried to block access to the app after the company continued to operate, despite a ban inaugurated after a passenger was raped by an Uber driver.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Uber's Indian rival Ola filed an affidavit claiming that Uber was violating state rules, using vehicles not licensed to operate as taxis.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: A rival to Uber claimed that the company had flouted the Reserve Bank of India's "two factor authentication mandate" for financial transactions. "This is not even some smart method of finding a loophole in the RBI guidelines but a blatant breach of the law of the land," the company said in a blog.

tag_line: Withdrew, was banned, or not permitted
2_sentence_summary: Since 2014, Uber has operated its app-based taxi service in Israel, but UberX is not available. There is a political dispute over whether to permit and regulate the service.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Has called for Internet service providers in Jordan to block the Uber app until it is officially licensed

tag_line: Made concessions to enter into a regulatory deal
2_sentence_summary: Mexico City government announced in July 2015 a deal to allow ride-hailing services to operate legally, in exchange for a 1.5% revenue tax. But by July 2016, the fund to receive the tax was yet to be created by officials for reasons that were unclear.

tag_line: Obtained light-touch regulation
2_sentence_summary: Legislators passed a resolution in June 2016 urging government "to recognise and integrate ridesharing into their transportation policies."

tag_line: Was accused of graft
2_sentence_summary: After dismissing an application for an injunction against right hailing services, courts are being asked to consider a "graft" lawsuit against the Transportation Secretary and a senior regulator for improperly allowing the operation of the services.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: 302 cars were seized from unlicensed Uber drivers between January and June 2016, an increase from 255 cars in the same period in 2015

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Authorities announced in May 2016 that a crackdown on unlicensed Uber drivers would commence the following month. Taxi unions were reported to be involved in entrapping drivers. In August 2016, early plans to deregulate taxicabs to allow them to compete with Uber were announced.

tag_line: Obtained light-touch regulation
2_sentence_summary: Uber won a High Court case in which the city transport authority sought legal clarity on whether the app amounted to a taximeter, and consequently whether its drivers were in violation of licensing regulations.

tag_line: Alleged to be in breach of licensing
2_sentence_summary: A taxi driver claims that Uber is in breach of its licensing in London because drivers accept jobs in-car

tag_line: Following opposition, decided not to start operating
2_sentence_summary: Uber allowed its application to operate in Oxford to lapse, after it failed to submit key documents by an August 2016 deadline. Although the local legacy industry had launched a campaign against a Uber, and even launched their own app, the company said that it would not rule out applying in future.

tag_line: Made concessions to enter into a regulatory deal
2_sentence_summary: A deal reached one hour before the end of legislative sessions for the fiscal year regulated Uber and other ride hailing apps by imposing a $.20 per ride surcharge, which would be divided between the municipality where the ride originated, the state and an adjustment fund for legacy industry drivers. Background checks and identifying vehicle decals were mandated.

tag_line: Obtained light-touch regulation
2_sentence_summary: Mayor Rahm Emmanuel pushed through light-touch regulation of Uber in Chicago in June 2016. His brother is an investor in the company.
upcoming_flashpoint: December 2016 flash point – six months deadline passes
notes: "Emanuel's brother, Hollywood superagent Ari Emanuel, is an Uber investor."

tag_line: Obtained light-touch regulation
2_sentence_summary: Regulations due to take effect in October 2016 were passed, which would require companies only to verify that the drivers are licensed, their cars are insured, and that they run background checks on drivers

tag_line: The authorities explored a regulatory proposal
2_sentence_summary: With regulations agreed in 2015 due for review, and Uber having failed to override metropolitan legislation in the state legislature, Uber faces the prospect of further regulation of new drivers. Reports also mentioned the company's lobbying operation.

tag_line: Made concessions to enter into a regulatory deal
2_sentence_summary: Legislators have proposed, but not yet passed, measures to regulate ride hailing services. Proposals include a per-ride tax, a ban on surge pricing, and an in-app tipping feature Uber's response was not immediately apparent.

tag_line: The authorities explored a regulatory proposal
2_sentence_summary: Competition in the industry was legalised in 2015, But the State Department of Labour got involved to investigate whether drivers needed to be treated as employees, which appears to be a reason that the service has not launched.
outcome: Ongoing, worker classification issues appear unresolved

tag_line: Denied an allegation of monopoly practices
2_sentence_summary: A Connecticut Uber rider has claimed in court that Uber's surge pricing amounts to a violation of anti-trust (anti-monopoly) law. The case generated a separate controversy after Uber was found to have used a CIA-linked research firm, which allegedly misrepresented itself in order to obtain information, to investigate the complainant and his lawyer.

tag_line: Made concessions to enter into a regulatory deal
2_sentence_summary: Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration has agreed not to cap growth of the higher-vehicle companies, including ride-hailing apps and traditional taxis, pending the conclusion of a four-month study into the impact of such companies on traffic congestion. As part of the agreement, Uber withdrew a range of aggressive anti-de Blasio adverts.

tag_line: Withdrew, was banned, or not permitted
2_sentence_summary: A bill that would have permitted ride hailing app companies to operate in New York state was passed by the state Senate but stalled in the Assembly, with opponents citing poor conditions for drivers – including a lack of workers' compensation – and background checks less rigourous than those used by traditional taxi services

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Uber won temporary permission to operate in Philadelphia, after a lobbying campaign given urgency by the arrival of the Democratic National Convention in the city in July 2016. Gov Tom Wolfe signed the temporary regulations into law shortly after a judge held up a previous decision prohibiting the company's operations, following application by Fair Ride Philly, a coalition of Uber and legacy taxi drivers, and disability rights activists. t was expected that permanent ride hailing legislation would be adopted in autumn 2016.

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: Uber initially operated illegally in the city, before agreeing to a temporary hiatus while regulations – relatively light touch – were hammered out under intense pressure from the company.

tag_line: The authorities explored a regulatory proposal
2_sentence_summary: Local Uber and local authorities had a dispute over who should conduct background checks on potential drivers

tag_line: Obtained light-touch regulation
2_sentence_summary: Uber launched in West Virginia with the support of the governor of Charleston and a US Sen, and apparently no regulation

tag_line: Flouted regulations
2_sentence_summary: After lawmakers enacted legislation requiring fingerprint background checks for ride-hailing drivers and several requirements for ride-hailing companies such as Uber, including a data reporting requirement, and lift sponsored a ballot initiative to overturn the regulations. The initiative failed, and as the companies had threatened to in that event, both left town.
outcome: Uber withdrew, alternatives emerge, lawsuit push back: http://www.aol.com/article/2016/06/17/texas-lawsuit-seeks-to-overturn-austins-uber-fingerprint-rule/21397530/
notes: "they pulled out of Austin after losing a legislative fight over driver screening, vehicle identification and data reporting. "

tag_line: Organised its interional business to dodge tax
2_sentence_summary: Uber has developed a corporate structure designed to allow it to minimise its international tax obligation by routing revenue through the Netherlands to Bermuda, which doesn't charge corporate income tax. However, the company currently makes little use of the structure, it argues, because it reinvests almost almost all revenue over costs to facilitate its global expansion.

tag_line: Organised its international business to dodge tax
2_sentence_summary: Uber paid only $9000 in tax in New Zealand on revenues of $1 million

tag_line: Organised its international business to dodge tax
2_sentence_summary: Uber paid only £22,000 on an £866,000 profit in 2015, a sum which it attributed to accounting losses in previous years. But the company also routes rider payments through the Netherlands, a practice which avoids VAT.

tag_line: Organised its international business to dodge tax
2_sentence_summary: Uber has assigned its intellectual property to a company based in Bermuda, an offshore tax haven, leaving less than 2% of net revenue profit susceptible to US taxation.

tag_line: Claimed drivers are contractors not workers to avoid respecting workers' rights
2_sentence_summary: Two drivers took Uber to an employment tribunal, arguing that they were improperly classified as private contractors, and denied rights such as holiday and sick pay

tag_line: Claimed drivers are contractors not workers to avoid respecting workers' rights
2_sentence_summary: Former Uber driver Todd Johnston filed a proposed class-action lawsuit against the company, claiming back pay and other benefits to which he would have been entitled as an employee
notes: "Losing an election would clearly fall into the unforeseen business circumstances category. If this lawsuit is without merit, it has potential to take the spotlight off the more significant lawsuits against Uber and related firms."

tag_line: Claimed drivers are contractors not workers to avoid respecting workers' rights
2_sentence_summary: A Boston man who drives for Uber filed a federal lawsuit, claiming that the company misclassified workers as independent contractors. The lawsuit was an echo of several others initiated around the country.

tag_line: Claimed drivers are contractors not workers to avoid respecting workers' rights
2_sentence_summary: In a major lawsuit over worker classification in Massachusetts and California, the presiding judge expressed concern in June 2016 over a proposed settlement between a number of Uber drivers represented by law firm and the company. Several of the original lead plaintiffs have expressed disquiet with the deal, which stops short of requiring Uber to accept that its drivers ought to be classified as employees.

tag_line: Claimed drivers are contractors not workers to avoid respecting workers' rights
2_sentence_summary: Uber’s planned expansion of driver monitoring programs, which it begun to trial in Houston in November 2015, could weaken its argument that its drivers are not employees, according to some commentators.

tag_line: Claimed drivers are contractors not workers to avoid respecting workers' rights
2_sentence_summary: A Chicago Uber driver initiated a lawsuit in May 2016 with a claim similar to other comparable suits which have been launched around the United States and elsewhere: that Uber has improperly classified its drivers as contractors, rather than employees. Such a designation would entitle drivers to retroactive compensation for lost earnings and other benefits.

tag_line: Claimed drivers are contractors not workers to avoid respecting workers' rights
2_sentence_summary: 5000 Uber drivers filed a lawsuit claiming that Uber wrongly classified them as independent contractors rather than employees. The lawsuit echoed eight similar cases pending in seven states, and four others that had, at that time, been sent to arbitration.
notes: "There are at least eight other claims pending in other states over the classification of Uber drivers. Uber rival Lyft has also faced legal issues over classification of its drivers as independent contractors."

tag_line: Claimed drivers are contractors not workers to avoid respecting workers' rights
2_sentence_summary: Legislation passed by the city allows drivers to unionise. But the US Chamber of Commerce, a federation of businesses, has filed a lawsuit to suspend the rule.

tag_line: Claimed drivers are contractors not workers to avoid respecting workers' rights
2_sentence_summary: In an echo of similar cases around the United States, a former Uber driver has sued the company for unpaid overtime, tips and other financial benefits, arguing that drivers ought to be properly classified as employees, not contractors. The suit seeks class-action status, covering all current and former drivers in Wisconsin.
